intro: Comanthera mucugensis, commonly known as the Mucugueira tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and has large, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, dark seeds.
